Type: Anti
manic
agent
Dosage Forms:
Routes of Administration: oral
Common Trade Names:

Adult_Dosing.text:
Maintenance: 300mg PO 3 to 4 times daily; desired serum lithium level 0.6 to 1.2 mEq/L
Acute manic episode: 600mg PO 3 times daily; desired serum lithium level 1 to 1.5 mEq/L

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: D
Lactation risk
: infant risk cannot be ruled out

Renal_Dosing.text:
Adult: Contraindicated if renal function unstable

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Unstable renal function
Severe dehydration
Sodium depletion
Severe debilitation
Concurrent diuretics
Severe cardiovascular disease
1st trimester pregnancy

Serious.text:
Toxicity (see
Lithium toxicity
)
Seizure, ataxia, raised ICP
Angioedema
Erythema multiforme

Common.text:

Nephrotoxicity
Fine tremor, hyperreflexia
Leukocytosis
Nausea, gastritis

Mechanism_of_Action.text:
Exact mechanism unclear; inhibits postsynaptic D2 receptor supersensitivity, alters cation transport in nerve cells, influences serotonin/norepinephrine reuptake, inhibits phosphatidylinositol cycle second messenger systems
